headline: Legs Versus Car
text: Principal architect Osborn McCutcheon estimates the need for one car space for every four students and one for each staff member, which proves wildly inaccurate

headline: Planning the campus
text: Sir Osborn McCutcheon, principal of leading architectural firm Bates, Smart and McCutcheon, is appointed to plan the site

headline: University Legislated
text: In March, Victorian Education Minister John Bloomfield introduces a bill to establish a new multi-faculty Monash University

headline: A Leader is Chosen
text: Robert Blackwood is chosen as first chair of the new university’s Interim Council – he later becomes its first Chancellor, serving from 1961 to 1968

headline: The Name Game
text: The new university is named Monash, after the World War I military leader, engineer and administrator

headline: The First Vice Chnacellor
text: English engineer Louis Matheson joins Monash, intrigued at the idea of building a new university from the ground up.

headline: Curtain Raises
text: Monash University becomes the first university established in Victoria in more than 100 years.

headline: The Farm
text: The first Monash students arrive for classes to a campus that's more like a muddy building site. Students dub it 'the farm'.

headline: The Computer Age
text: University Buys a Ferranti Sirius Computer.

headline: Arts faculty Founded
text: The Faculty of Arts opens, headed by Dean Bill Scott. The new Faculty would take up residence in half of the still-to-be-built Menzies Building.

headline: The Orginal Student Body
text: Of the first cohort of 347 students over 85 per cent of students are enrolled in arts, medicine, and economics and politics; only 16 per cent are registered for Science or Engineering courses. Men outnumber women three to one, and almost 10 per cent of the students come from overseas.

headline: A New Science Faculty
text: The Science Faculty is founded. The first years of the Faculty of Science were spent trying to define what kind of faculty it would be.

headline: Faculty of Medicine Founded
text: The Faculty of Medicine is founded and sets the pace for a new model of medical training.

headline: Faculty of Engineering Founded
text: The Faculty of Engineering is founded, considered by the Interim Council to be one of the most important of the new university.

headline: The Hargrave Library Opens
text: The Hargrave Library is officially opened by Professor Sir Keith Hancock, after operating from the ground floor of the Science Faculty during 1961

headline: The First Hall of Residence
text: Deakin Hall, named for Australia’s second Prime Minister Alfred Deakin, is the first Monash Hall of Residence to open, housing 53 men and 23 women.

headline: The First Grads
text: The first Monash graduation takes place a year ahead of schedule when Richard Cashman completes his Masters in History and Richard Harcourt his PhD in Chemistry

headline: Main Library
text: The Main Library began as one building in 1964 and became three connected buildings by 1993

headline: Aborginal Affairs
text: The centre for reserach into aborginal affairs is established

headline: Monash Law Opens
text: Monash’s Law School opens. The Law Building is not completed until 1968, so classes are held in the Engineering Building.

headline: Music Comes to Monash
text: A small music department opens, its initial focus is on musicology and music developed by other cultures.Now a school, it has been renamed the Sir Zelman Cowen School of Music

headline: The First Female Professor
text: Maureen Brunt is appointed to a chair in Economics. The daughter of a working-class Coburg grocer, she is only the third woman named to a chair in Australia

headline: The MSA is born
text: Student Representative Council declares itself irrelevant and disbands. Students vote to replace it with the Monash Students’ Association

headline: Law Scchool Gets a Home
text: The David Derham School of Law building opens, named in honour of Foundation Law Faculty Dean, David Derham.

headline: A Semester System
text: Monash introduced semester system

headline: Wind Power
text: The wind tunnel testing facility is launched

headline: Banking on Monash
text: The University creates Montech, a high-tech consulting company, in response to Ray Martin’s belief in offsetting shrinking budgets by creating its own funding

headline: Monash Looks to Malaysisa
text: Vice-Chancellor Mal Logan gets his chance to further Monash’s presence in Asia after the approach of Malaysian entrepreneur Jeffrey Cheah. The ‘twinning’ of the private Sunway College near Kuala Lumpur means its students take the first year or two of a Monash degree in Malaysia then complete their degrees on a Monash campus.

headline: Monash Expands
text: A significant merger with the Chisholm Institute is completed, which saw the Caulfield and Peninsula campuses become part of Monash University on 1 July.

headline: High Tech faculty
text: The Faculty of Information Technology is established out of the merger of Monash University and the Chisholm Institute of Technology in Caulfield

headline: Taking Students to the world
text: Monash Abroad is launched to help students develop an ‘international perspective'

headline: A liitle Bit of Parkville
text: The Faculty of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences is created through a merger with the Victorian College of Pharmacy following the Dawkins reforms.

headline: A Business Merger
text: The David Syme Business School at Caulfield merges with the Faculty of Business and Economics, forming a new multi-campus faculty.

headline: Berwick Beginning
text: The Berwick Campus Opens

headline: MADA is Founded
text: The faculty of Art, Design and Architecture is founded

headline: Monash Malaysisa
text: Monash University Malaysia becomes the first foreign university to establish a campus in Malaysia.

headline: Group of Eight
text: Monash becomes a founding member of the Group of Eight.

headline: Into Africa
text: A second offshore campus is opened in South Africa. Vice-Chancellor David Robinson feels the campus is key to the University’s long-term vision for itself

headline: A Palace in Prato
text: Monash gets an Italian base with the opening of the Prato Centre in a restored palazzo in the town of Prato, just outside of Florence.

headline: A Green University
text: Monash makes the move towards more sustainable policies, from switching to 100% recycled paper at the Matheson Library to going plastic bag-free on campus.

headline: Monash Malaysia Campus Opens
text: The Deputy Prime Minister of Malaysia, Dato' Sri Najib Abdul Razak, officially opens the new Monash Malaysia campus.

headline: Architecture Arrives
text: The first intake of students start the Monash architecture degree – a course designed to tackle the needs of the 21st century.

headline: Indian Australian partnership
text: The IITB-Monash Research Academy opens in Mumbai, India.

headline: Monash Goes to China
text: The first university approved to operate a university in China, Monash undertakes a partnership with Southeast University to open a Joint Graduate School

headline: Monash Warwick Alliance
text: Monash enters another global university partnership with the University of Warwick in England.

headline: Gravitational Wave Discovered
text: Monash researchers support LIGO in the detection of gravitational waves generated by two colliding black holes.
